# NSUndoManagerWillUndoChange

**Type Property**

Posted just before an undo manager performs an undo operation.

## Declaration

```swift
static let NSUndoManagerWillUndoChange: NSNotification.Name
```

## Discussion

If you invoke [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undo()] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undoNestedGroup()], this notification is posted. The notification object is the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager] object. This notification doesn’t contain a `userInfo` dictionary.

The system posts this notification on the actor, thread, or dispatch queue that calls [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager/undo()].

## Working with notifications

- **NSUndoManagerDidUndoChange**: Posted just after an undo manager performs an undo operation.
- **NSUndoManagerWillRedoChange**: Posted just before an undo manager performs a redo operation.
- **NSUndoManagerDidRedoChange**: Posted just after an undo manager performs a redo operation.
- **NSUndoManagerCheckpoint**: Posted whenever an undo manager opens or closes an undo group (except when it opens a top-level group) and when checking the redo stack.
- **NSUndoManagerDidOpenUndoGroup**: Posted whenever an undo manager opens an undo group.
- **NSUndoManagerWillCloseUndoGroup**: Posted before an undo manager closes an undo group.
- **NSUndoManagerDidCloseUndoGroup**: Posted after an undo manager closes an undo group.
- **NSUndoManagerGroupIsDiscardableKey**: A key, used in a notification’s user info, that indicates the undo group contains only discardable actions.
